preset.name: High Quality: HiFi, home or quiet listening
preset.comment: This preset (~190 kbps) will produce transparent encoding (transparent = most people cannot distinguish the mp3 from the original in an ABX blind test). The preset is equivalent to the old "--preset fast standard" preset. Command line used: "-V2 --vbr-new"

preset.name: High Quality: Continuous album encoding (nogap encoding)
preset.comment: Album preset that additionally uses the "nogap" feature of LAME. This preset is the same as the "High Quality" one, except that it enables LAME nogap encoding. With this feature turned on, you can encode continuous mix CD's to mp3 safely. When playing back the created mp3's (e.g. with Winamp + gapless output plugin), there will be no hearable clicks, pops or gaps. Command line used: "-V2 --vbr-new --nogap"

preset.name: Archiving: Best Quality
preset.comment: This is the strongest setting for MP3, with the lowest risk of artifacts. With the exception of a few situations, quality is rarely better than the highest VBR profiles. Command line used: "-b 320 --cbr"

preset.name: Podcast: Mono, CBR, 64kbps
preset.comment: This preset will produce a standard podcast with mono encoding and a constant bit rate of 64kbps. Command line used: "-b 64 -m m -q2 --cbr" See: http://www.richardfarrar.com/how-to-use-winlame-to-encode-podcasts/

preset.name: Portable: background noise and low bitrate requirement, small sizes
preset.comment: This preset will produce files suitable listening to on a portable (~115 kbps). Command line used: "-V6 --vbr-new"

preset.name: VirtualDub: audio track compression, CBR at 128 kbps
preset.comment: This preset will produce "wave mp3" files suitable VirtualDub audio mp3 compression, CBR 128 kbps (VBR and ABR are unsuitable here, since the audio track has to be in sync with the video track). This preset can be used to compress audio streams to mp3, for use e.g. in VirtualDub. A RIFF WAVE Header is prepended to the mp3 data, and the file extension will be ".wav". It uses constant bitrate encoding at 128 kbps. Command line used: "-b 128 --cbr"

preset.name: Music Storage: Normal listening
preset.comment: Music Storage: At 128 Kbps VBR, Opus is pretty much transparent. Command line used: "--bitrate 128 --vbr --comp 10" See also: https://wiki.xiph.org/Opus_Recommended_Settings

preset.name: Music Storage: Maximum settings
preset.comment: Music Storage: At 128 Kbps VBR, Opus is pretty much transparent. For people who want the maximum settings, this preset uses 256 Kbps, which may or may not be excessive and create larger files than needed. Command line used: "--bitrate 256 --vbr --comp 10" See also: https://wiki.xiph.org/Opus_Recommended_Settings

preset.name: Audiobooks / Podcasts: Smaller size
preset.comment: Audiobooks / Podcasts: Uses a 32 Kbps VBR to save on size of the file, so that more audio can be stored on portable devices. Don't use this for storage. Command line used: "--bitrate 32 --vbr --comp 10" See also: https://wiki.xiph.org/Opus_Recommended_Settings

preset.name: Very-near-CD-quality
preset.comment: Most people seeking very-near-CD-quality audio encode at a quality of 5 or, for lossless stereo coupling, 6. This preset uses quality 6. Yields ~192 kbit/s. Command line used: "-q 6" See also: http://wiki.hydrogenaud.io/index.php?title=Recommended_Ogg_Vorbis

preset.name: Ogg Vorbis Default
preset.comment: The default setting is quality 3, which at approximately 110kbps gives a smaller filesize and significantly better fidelity than .mp3 compression at 128kbps. Yields ~112 kbit/s. Command line used: "-q 3" See also: http://wiki.hydrogenaud.io/index.php?title=Recommended_Ogg_Vorbis

preset.name: Standard Wave File, 16 bit
preset.comment: This creates a standard Wave file, with 16 bit sample resolution.

preset.name: FLAC lossless from 16 bit audio
preset.comment: This creates a FLAC losless file; input sample resolution is suitable for 16 bit audio files.

preset.name: AAC: Default quality setting
preset.comment: The default quality setting for faac, q=100, generates files at an average bitrate of approx. 128kbps. This quality level is good enough for casual, non-critical listening, but note that other encoders for AAC and other compressed formats may provide better quality files at similar bitrates. Command line used: "-q 100" See also: http://wiki.hydrogenaud.io/index.php?title=FAAC

preset.name: AAC: Better quality encoding
preset.comment: For better quality encoding, q=150 is suggested, resulting in average bitrates around 175kbps. Based on (subjective) tests, at this quality level faac provides high quality artifact free music reproduction and is comparable in quality to proprietary AAC encoders at similar bitrates. Command line used: "-q 150" See also: http://wiki.hydrogenaud.io/index.php?title=FAAC
